snippet: Countries like China, India and Brazil are expected to drive global growth in drug spending over the next five years, a report finds.
abstract: IMS Institute for Healthcare Informatics says emerging markets like China, India and Brazil are expected to drive global growth in drug spending over the next five years; forecasts global spending will total almost $1.2 trillion by 2016, or 5 percent to 7 percent growth, from $956 billion in 2011, or 3 percent to 4 percent growth.
lead_paragraph: Countries like China, India and Brazil are expected to drive global growth in drug spending over the next five years, a report finds.

headline.main: Drug Makers’ Growth Is Linked to Emerging Markets
headline.print_headline: Drug Makers’ Growth Is Linked to Emerging Markets
